result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Received and Filed.
signed and filed.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi not in court.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for return on doctors report.  
Court is receipt of letter from Dr Pankiewicz stating Correctional staff indicated Ms. Grover-Tsimi refused to meet
with me .
Court advised by the deputy that the defendant refused to appear for today's hearing. 
Court orders the defendant remanded for in patient evaluation at one of the two state mental health institutes.  
Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 19.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter/correspondence from defendant.  (Vivian D. Grover-Tsimi - #2022008594, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received and Filed: Refusal letter.
Defendant's Notice to the Court.  (Vivian D. Grover-Tsimi - #2022008594, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi not in court.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Arraignment. 
Court advised by the Sheriff Deputy defendant refused to leave her cell.
State Raises competency advising the court  there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, 
Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings  and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

signed and filed.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi not in court.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an Arraignment.
Per the Deputy Defendant refused to appear before the court via zoom.
State raises competency. Court ordered case adjourned to have defendant produced in person.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Arraignment scheduled October 5, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi not in court, without counsel.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for arraignment. The Honorable Laura Crivello has recused herself from this case. Per call to the Clerk of Courts office, case is reassigned to the Honorable Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment in Branch 19. Arraignment scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed.
Received and Filed: Proposed Order Regarding Discovery

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Defendant appeared Pro Se. Sworn for the State: MCSO Deputy D. Walton. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Court notes for the record that the defendant exhibited disruptive behavior throughout the hearing. Court orders that the matter be set for an Arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi in court Pro Se.  Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Vivian D Grover-Tsimi appeared by video means.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense moves to dismiss the complaint. Arguments heard by parties. Motion is denied. Case is adjourned due to time constraints. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRR AND MIR.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Initial Appearance. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived right to counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vivian D Grover-Tsimi in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant is advised that due to the charging DA this case has been re-assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant claims sovereign citizenship and appears Pro Se. Court ordered case be adjourned before circuit court for adjourned initial appearance for competency regarding self representation. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court ordered bail to remain as set on the  ADR.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
